reasoning: Interstitial cystitis/painful bladder syndrome measured as prevalence. Estimated ~197 per 100k (predominantly women, 9:1 ratio) based on early 2000s epidemiological studies. Wide diagnostic variability affects estimates. Chronic condition, incidence poorly defined.
source: Clemens JQ et al. (2005). Prevalence and incidence of interstitial cystitis in a managed care population. J Urol. 173(1):98-102
